results.title: The Fell locomotive
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Roy Harris and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A description of a new locomotive being produced in England. This is the first completely diesel engine to be evolved and an entirely new method of transmitting power to the wheels is incorporated in it. The film illustrates the advantages it has over steam, electric and diesel electric locomotives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter De Normanville, Roy Harris and Shell Film Unit

results.title: The Feeling of hostility
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the factors producing resentment and hostility in personal relationships. In the story of Clare we see how the death of her father and the later remarriage of her mother discouraged her from seeking affectional relationships with others. Although successful at college and in her business career, she feels the lack of fellowship and understanding. The factors behind this emotional inadequacy are reviewed by a psychiatrist. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: The Flaming mountain = Huo yan shan
results.creator_credit: Huang En, Wu Fanghai and Changchun Film Studio
results.brief_description:
This is a theatrical rendition of a chapter from the classic Ming novel ‘Journey to the West’. Singing rendered excerpts from the original text in the tradition of Beijing Opera, the film recounts the tribulations of a fiery mountain pass, and the cunning and hardships undergone to disperse the raging flames, so the fellowship may advance on their quest.
The group arrives at a mountain where the rocks are so hot you can cook a meal off of them. The Western pass is covered in fire for over 800 Li, and even the wild beasts dare not enter by that way. By and by, it is revealed to them, of an old man, that this mountain is under the dominion of a forlorn spirit queen, who has been discarded by her husband all alone in the depths of the Bajiao Caves (芭蕉洞). The fiery passage up ahead can be cleared only by the magical fan in her possession. They travel to seek an audience with the lady of the caves, Luosha, who sings of her tale; destitute from the loss of her husband and the lonesome existance she is forced to live out in the cold depths of the earth. After entreating her for use of the fan they discover she is reluctant to part with it, and the inevitable battle commences. Monkey and Luosha fight and she blows him away with the fan.
Monkey regains consciousness outside a temple, whose abbott receives him graciously. After Monkey explains his predicament, the Abbott offers him a magic ball to help him convince Luosha to lend him the fan. Meanwhile, Queen Luosha plans on using the fan again to blow Wukong away forever. Wukong infiltrates her stomach, forcing her to give up the fan. But when Wukong and Pigsy try to disperse the flames, the fan only seems to increase them. It’s not long before they realise their prized fan is a fake. Wukong goes to find the king who left her to beg his favor, but they fight when the King accuses Monkey of killing his son (which he did).
Monkey is instead forced to duplicate himself and present himself to Luosha as her long-lost husband, returned at last to see her. He makes off with the fan, but in turn is tricked out of the fan by the real king. Monkey and Pigsy return to the cave to battle it out with the King, Queen and their minions. This disturbs the mountain dragon, who comes out to fight them. All ends well, however, with the flames being dispersed and the party continuing its journey.

Cultural History of the Film:

The acrobatics are highly impressive.
High production values for the time.
Still retains a very potent theatrical style.
Some beautiful mountainous landscapes.
(3 stars - James Donald; June 10, 2011)

results.title: The Fisherman
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Brian Woods, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Centred on the southern New South Wales coastal town of Eden, this film looks at the background of one of Australia’s basic primary industries - tuna fishing. The film examines the daily routine of one of the typical fishing families in the town.

results.title: The First priority
results.creator_credit: Joe O'Brien, Ray Davey, National Educational Television and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A comprehensive summary of the world food problem indicating why it is such a crucial problem today. Shows how the FAO is already coping with the problem and how the campaign is aimed at showing people all over the world what can be done. Gives examples of action projects aimed at long term solutions.

results.title: The First moving picture show
results.brief_description: A short claymation piece giving a unique perspective on early cinema. Plasticine models and simple drawings are combined with limited dialogue to show how pictures were made to move.

results.title: The First Christmas
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Van Blerk and XYZOO Animation
results.brief_description: Christopher Plummer narrates this delightful clay animation version of the story of the birth of Christ. Features traditional carols such as “Silent night”, “We three kings”, “O Come all ye faithful”, “O Little town of Bethlehem”, and “Joy to the world”. (Awards: Winner 1999 Andrew Carnegie Medal for Excellence in Children’s video)

results.title: The First animated step
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Early history of primitive film technology coupled with an explanation and examples of different types of animation. This documentary also shows how animation is achieved by both professionals and amateurs. A film for students and teachers.

results.title: The Final cut
results.creator_credit: Mike Vardy, Ken Riddington and BBC
results.brief_description: Urquhart is determined to remain in power longer than Margaret Thatcher but as that time approaches, his hold on the poltical ladder is not as firm. Tom Makepeace, the Foreign Secretary is likely to be his successor and is encouraged by his mistress to challenge the leadership. Urquhart’s past is threatening to overtake him but he and his wife are determined that his years as the Prime Minister will end in glory, not defeat. Ian Richardson is superb as Francis Urquhart in a compelling performance and this finale to the Urquhart story is both gripping and dramatic.

results.title: Directions (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. This episode focuses on Twentieth Century landscape imagery, the leaders of this style were Olsen, Rose and Smith. Other artists whose work is discussed include Godfrey Miller, Ian Fairweather, Fred Williams and Brett Whitely. Written and narrated by Robert Hughes.
